snippet: Lawsuits alleging wage theft and other infractions were filed against McDonald’s in a bold escalation in the battle by fast-food workers for better pay.
abstract: Editorial contends lawsuits brought by McDonald's workers against company and franchise owners over the violation of federal labor laws are a bold escalation in battle for better pay and right to unionize; notes legal action is only one of the ways to try to effect change, and proliferation of low-wage work nationwide demands policies to lift wages.
lead_paragraph: Lawsuits alleging wage theft and other infractions were filed against McDonald’s in a bold escalation in the battle by fast-food workers for better pay.
